acceptance

Class AcceptanceGeneric

  • java.lang.Object
    • acceptance.AcceptanceGeneric
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AcceptanceOmega, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class AcceptanceGeneric
extends java.lang.Object
implements AcceptanceOmega
    A generic acceptance condition (based on BitSet state sets). This is an AST of a boolean formula (conjunction and disjunction) over atoms of the form Inf(states), Inf(!states), Fin(states) and Fin(!states).
    Semantics: Inf(states) <=> G F states Inf(!states) <=> G F !states Fin(states) <=> F G !states Fin(!states) <=> F G states

      • and

        public AcceptanceGeneric and(AcceptanceGeneric other)
        Returns a new generic acceptance condition that corresponds to the conjunction of this and the other acceptance condition. Both conditions are not cloned; take care not to modify the conditions or clone beforehand.
        Parameters:
        other - the other generic acceptance condition
        Returns:
        new AcceptanceRabin, conjunction of this and other

      • or

        public AcceptanceGeneric or(AcceptanceGeneric other)
        Returns a new generic acceptance condition that corresponds to the disjunction of this and the other acceptance condition. Both conditions are not cloned; take care not to modify the conditions or clone beforehand.
        Parameters:
        other - the other generic acceptance condition
        Returns:
        new AcceptanceGeneric, disjunction of this and other

        public void lift(AcceptanceOmega.LiftBitSet lifter)
        Description copied from interface: AcceptanceOmega
        Lift the state sets in the acceptance condition. For each state set states in the condition, lifter.lift(states) is called and the state set is replaced by the result.

      • toAcceptanceRabin

        public AcceptanceRabin toAcceptanceRabin(int numStates)
        Attempt to convert this generic acceptance condition to a Rabin condition. If this condition does not have the required form (top-level disjunctions with conjunctive pairs), returns null.
        If the condition does not syntactically have the required from but can be easily converted to one (e.g., by converting a single Inf(S) to a Fin(emptyset) & Inf(S) etc) or by swapping Inf and Fin, this will be done.
        The BitSets for the state sets are cloned, i.e., modifications of the state sets of the returned acceptance condition will not affect the original generic acceptance condition.
        Parameters:
        numStates - the number of states in the underlying model/automaton (for generating state sets for true)
        Returns:
        the generated AcceptanceRabin condition, or false on failure

      • toAcceptanceRabinPair

        private AcceptanceRabin.RabinPair toAcceptanceRabinPair(int numStates)
        Attempt to convert this generic acceptance to a Rabin pair.
        Parameters:
        numStates - the number of states in the underlying model/automaton (for generating state sets for true)
        Returns:
        the generated RabinPair, or false on failure

      • toAcceptanceStreett

        public AcceptanceStreett toAcceptanceStreett(int numStates)
        Attempt to convert this generic acceptance condition to a Streett condition. If this condition does not have the required form (top-level conjunction with disjunctive pairs), returns null.
        If the condition does not syntactically have the required from but can be easily converted to one (e.g., by converting a single Inf(S) to a Fin(true) | Inf(S) etc) or by swapping Inf and Fin, this will be done.
        The BitSets for the state sets are cloned, i.e., modifications of the state sets of the returned acceptance condition will not affect the original generic acceptance condition.
        Parameters:
        numStates - the number of states in the underlying model/automaton (for generating state sets for true)
        Returns:
        the generated AcceptanceRabin condition, or false on failure

      • toAcceptanceStreettPair

        private AcceptanceStreett.StreettPair toAcceptanceStreettPair(int numStates)

        numStates - the number of states in the underlying model/automaton (for generating state sets for true)
        Returns:
        the generated RabinPair, or false on failure

      • extractDisjuncts

        public java.util.List<AcceptanceGeneric> extractDisjuncts()
        Extract the operands of the top-level disjunctions, e.g., for (A & B) | (C | D)) would return the list [A&B,C,D].

      • extractConjuncts

        public java.util.List<AcceptanceGeneric> extractConjuncts()
        Extract the operands of the top-level conjunctions, e.g., for (A | B) & (C & D)) would return the list [A|B,C,D].
